summary: The TypeScript SDK docs reference a deprecated `nodeModulesPaths` option that was removed from WorkerOptions, causing type errors when developers follow the documentation. The option is no longer needed as the SDK now automatically detects node_modules correctly.
userImpact: Developers following the official documentation receive TypeScript compilation errors when trying to use the outdated nodeModulesPaths option.
rootCause: The nodeModulesPaths option was removed from WorkerOptions because the SDK now automatically detects node_modules, but the documentation was not updated to reflect this change.
proposedFix: Update the documentation to remove references to nodeModulesPaths and explain that the SDK now handles node_modules detection automatically.
workaround: Remove the nodeModulesPaths option from Worker.create() configuration.
resolutionDetails: Documentation was updated in temporalio/documentation PR #1425 to remove references to the deprecated nodeModulesPaths option.
keyQuote: We removed it, as we should now always detect it correctly. If you remove the option, does it work?
